channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Spirit Airlines says it will furlough 270 pilots and demote 140 captains to first officers
Even AI tools like ChatGPT think your employees should be making more money
item.description: Payscale found a growing gap between employer and employee salary expectations, and GenAI tools are contributing to a new norm.

item.title: Europe Made Major Trade Concessions to Trump. How Did That Happen?

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Is First Republican Lawmaker to Call Gaza Crisis a ‘Genocide’
item.description: Ms. Greene is the first Republican in Congress to use the term to describe the dire humanitarian situation in Gaza, two years after she led the push t...

item.title: ‘Worst-Case Scenario of Famine’ Unfolding in Gaza, U.N.-Backed Body Says
item.description: Access to food has plummeted to unprecedented levels, a monitoring group warned, as global outrage over Israel’s aid restrictions persisted.

item.title: Meet the 40-something self-made ‘everyday millionaires’ who say they still don’t feel rich

item.title: Wesley LePatner, a 44-year-old Blackstone executive who oversaw its $53 billion real-estate investment fund, was killed in Manhattan’s mass shooting
item.description: LePatner one of four victims of Monday's mass shooting in New York City.

item.title: Park Avenue Gunman Drove Cross Country Before the Attack, Police Said
item.description: The police said that he had a history of mental illness documented in Nevada and that it was unclear why he targeted the building.

item.title: Paul Gallagher, Brother of Oasis Band Members, Is Charged With Rape
item.description: Paul Gallagher, the older brother of Liam and Noel Gallagher, was also accused of making death threats, the authorities said.
